scenarioDescription:
The TOI-1634 Exoplanetary System


Overview

TOI-1634 is a star with 0.5 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.45 times its radius. It is located 115.05 light years away from the solar system.

TOI-1634 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the TOI-1634 system


TOI-1634 b

TOI-1634 b was discovered by the Transiting Exoplanet Survey Satellite (TESS) observatory, in 2021-03, using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.02 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of TOI-1634 b is 4.913 times the mass of Earth. The radius of TOI-1634 b is 1.790 that of Earth. At 4.913 Earth masses, TOI-1634 b is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanetary system TOI-1634, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the Transiting Exoplanet Survey Satellite (TESS).
name: TOI-1634 - System With 1 Exoplanet
